channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10024] Add an interface to create put with immutable arrays
item.description: The 'Put' does a copy of the data. This simplifies the client, as there is no risk to modify something used someone else. But it means we do a lot of array copy, including within HBase code when we create the 'Put' server side....
item.summary: Add an interface to create put with immutable arrays

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch lgtm.

Rather than add new API though, should this just be the default behavior instead? On second thoughts, maybe not. The default is friendlier.

I'd be +1 on commit.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12615640/10024.96.v1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7988//console

This message is automatically generated.

Rather than add new API though, should this just be the default behavior instead?

Well it's a behavior change, so keeping the default is safer I think.
This is just for the family. We could do it for the row as well, going further in hijacking protobuf, and using the hidden byte array of LiteralByteString...

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12615644/10024.trunk.v1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitLogWorker

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7989//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.

Nicolas Liochon The QA test failure https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7989//testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver/TestSplitLogWorker/testAcquireMultiTasks is due to the 3 seconds are a little bit shorter in some case because each split log task acquire could take a bit time which spent in ZK and sleep between. You can change the following timeout to 6000(6 seconds) in file TestSplitLogWorker upon your commit or I can submit a small patch on that. 


 waitForCounter(SplitLogCounters.tot_wkr_task_acquired, 0, maxTasks, 3000);

Thanks.
Thanks a lot Jeffrey. I've changed this. v2 is what I will commit on trunk. I'm doing the same change for .96.
